workout_file.description: Tempo training: The goal of this training is to spend time in Zone 3 at an intensity where the use of sugar and fats as fuel is equal. Time spent in this zone increases muscle glycogen storages.
workout_file.name: Week 4.4 - Tempo

textevent.message: Welcome back to this week's Tempo workout! Today will be a good challenge, so let's get warmed up!
Quick check to make sure you have your bottles, fan, and towel all set. You're going to need them today!
All right, that's halfway through the warmup. Let's chat a little bit about today's workout.
We're starting off today with a block of tempo intervals, namely 5 times, 5mins at 88% FTP, with 2mins rest between.
Then, we'll move onto a challenging 14min zone 3/4 interval.
And finish with a few 2min zone 4 intervals, woo wee!
So, plenty of work to be done today, my friend! But, you're ready for it and will CRUSH the day!
1min to go here, then we'll move right into our first 5min tempo interval.
I want you to keep your cadence at 95 RPM for this first interval, let's make it happen today!
Here we go! Bring your cadence up to 95 RPM and settle into it.
Great work so far. You should feel relatively adjusted to this effort, now aim for consistency here.
Relax your shoulders, bend your elbow slightly, and loosen the grip on your bars, steady as you go!
Final minute! Keep that cadence consistent right to the end here.
Excellent work! That's 1 down and 2 more to go. We'll take 2mins easy here.
Take a few deep breaths and make sure you're sipping those fluids.
Next up, we're going to do a ramp up, but again at 95 RPM from start to finish, ready?
All right, we're starting off at 86% FTP here, and ramping up to 90%.
Make sure you're keeping your cadence ~95 RPM again here.
Steadily increase that power here, but maintain your cadence.
Final minute again for this 2nd interval, you're doing great!
Push it all the way to the arch!
Nicely done! Let's take a couple of minutes easy again here and a few sips of fluid.
Next up, I want you to aim for 100+ RPM from start to finish, really get those legs spinning!
Bring the power up again, and get those legs turning over quick!
Make sure you're not bouncing in the saddle or lurching back and forth at this cadence.
Hopefully you've seen some improvement here over the last 4wks.
Relax the tension in your shoulders again, stay relaxed as you put the work in!
60sec to go! Push the cadence just a bit higher if you can!
Woo! You're doing great today! Let's bring it down nice and easy again here and rest for a couple of minutes.
Deep breaths...relax here.
All right, our last of these is going to be at 95 RPM again, get ready to go!
Bring your cadence up to 95 RPM and settle into this final 5min interval.
Feeling a little bit of cumulative fatigue by now is okay, keep pushing yourself!
Relax your shoulders, bend your elbow slightly, and loosen the grip on your bars, steady as you go!
Final minute! Keep that cadence consistent right to the end here.
Great work! That's 20mins at tempo completed so far today :-)
Let's take 2mins nice and easy here, then we have a big interval coming up next!
Next up, we have a 14min interval consisting of zone 3/4 work.
We'll be mixing up the cadence during this long interval, so pay attention here for what's next.
This is going to be a challenge, but you got this!
All right, let's start off at 90 RPM at tempo.
Here we go! Let's dig in here and get this big chunk of work done well!
Settle down now, Keep things nice and consistent for these next 2mins.
Next up, we're going to move up to zone 4 for 6mins, and also increase the cadence a bit.
Let's lift the cadence to 95 RPM now, and bring the power right up to FTP.
Stick with this! This is where the past 4wks of hard work will pay off.
Next up, we're going to stay working at FTP, but bring your cadence up again to 100 RPM!
FAST FEET! This is where the work starts, my friend. Push yourself and get stronger here!
C'mon! Grit those teeth and get this interval done! You're doing great here!
We're going to drop the intensity just a bit next and head back down to 90 RPM.
Awesome work! Let's use this block to try and 'rest' a bit - take a few deep breaths.
Keep going here! I know you're starting to feel tired, but this is when you get stronger!
1min to go here, then we're going to finish this interval with 2mins at FTP at 100 RPM!
Spin those legs up again 1 more time! Let's finish this!
FAST FEET again! C'mon, get those legs turning over quick!
Just 1min to go! DIG DIG!
Push it all the way to the arch!
Amazing!! That was the toughest interval of this whole plan yet and you nailed it!
You should be proud of yourself for that one :-) Let's take a few minutes easy now.
Coming up in 1min, we have 3, 2min intervals right at FTP.
I want you to aim for 90-100 RPM for each of these.
All right, let's squeeze the last little bit out of those legs!
Bring the power back up right to FTP again here. Just 2mins here, pice of cake for you!
That's halfway already! Keep it going here!
Get to that arch!
Excellent work! Just 2 more to go and we check this workout off!
Take a few deep breaths here, you've done a lot of work today!
Ready? 30sec and we're repeating that again.
Let's go! Quick feet again here and solid effort.
Halfway again! You're looking great here! Keep it going!
Just 30sec to go! Don't let your cadence drop off now!
Yes! That was great! Just 1 more to go, phew! Let's take a few minutes easy peasy.
All right, our final interval on the day is just ahead...Let's make it happen!
Bring the power back up right to FTP again here.
That's halfway already! Keep it going here!
Get to that arch!
BOOM! Done and dusted that workout. Really nice effort today from start to finish!
We're going to spend a few minute cooling down now, and then hop off the bike.
Enjoy the last few minutes of the cool down, and we'll see you next time!
